name: Lead
description: Lead is a toxic metal that can cause serious health problems, especially in children. It is commonly found in batteries, paints, and certain types of glass.

name: Cadmium
description: Cadmium is a highly toxic metal used in batteries, pigments, and coatings. It can cause kidney damage and bone loss.

name: Mercury
description: Mercury is a toxic element found in thermometers, fluorescent lamps, and switches. It can damage the nervous system.

name: Hexavalent Chromium
description: Hexavalent chromium is used in anti-corrosion coatings and pigments. It is carcinogenic and can cause skin irritation.

name: Polybrominated Biphenyls
description: PBBs are flame retardants used in plastics. They are persistent organic pollutants and can disrupt endocrine systems.

name: Polybrominated Diphenyl Ethers
description: PBDEs are used as flame retardants in electronics and textiles. They are persistent and bioaccumulative toxins.

name: Di(2-ethylhexyl) phthalate
description: DEHP is a plasticizer used to make plastics flexible. It can disrupt hormones and cause reproductive toxicity.

name: Benzyl butyl phthalate
description: BBP is used as a plasticizer in PVC. It can disrupt endocrine systems and cause reproductive harm.

name: Dibutyl phthalate
description: DBP is used as a plasticizer and can cause developmental and reproductive toxicity.

name: Diisobutyl phthalate
description: DIBP is used as a plasticizer and can disrupt hormones and cause reproductive toxicity.

name: Hexabromocyclododecane
description: HBCDD is a brominated flame retardant used in insulation materials. It is persistent and bioaccumulative.

name: Perfluorooctane sulfonic acid (PFOS)
description: PFOS is a persistent organic pollutant used in stain repellents and firefighting foams.

name: PFOS Compounds
description: PFOS compounds are used in various industrial applications and are persistent organic pollutants.

name: Polybrominated Diphenyl Ethers (PBDE)
description: PBDEs are flame retardants used in plastics and textiles. They are persistent and bioaccumulative.
